sourcesContent:
import React, { useEffect, useState, Component } from 'react'; import { useParams, Redirect } from "react-router-dom"; import Select from 'react-select'; import axios from 'axios'; import 'bootstrap/dist/css/bootstrap.min.css'; class Dropdown extends Component { constructor(props){ super(props) this.state = { selectOptions : [], id: "", title: '', text: '', q1text: '', q2text: '', q3text: '', q4text: '', q5text: '' } } async getOptions(){ const res = await axios.get('/rating') const data = res.data const options = data.map(d => ({ "value" : d._id, "label" : d.title, "content": d.text })) this.setState({selectOptions: options}) } handleChange(e){ this.setState({id:e.value, title:e.label, text:e.content}) } componentDidMount(){ this.getOptions() } render() { console.log(this.state.selectOptions) return (
< Select placeholder="Please choose text" options={this.state.selectOptions} onChange={this.handleChange.bind(this)} />

{this.state.title}

{this.state.id}

{this.state.text}

{category === "Text level" && (

Text level

Please specify text (i.e: "Text 1")

How many main ideas does this text discuss?

How many of the main ideas of the text are forecast in the introduction? (If there is no introduction, write N/A)

How many of the main ideas of the text are summarized in the conclusion? (If there is no conclusion, write N/A.)

On a scale of 1 to 4, how well does the essay address the topic of the prompt?

On a scale of 1 to 4, rate the strength of the thesis statement. (Use N/A if there is no thesis statement.)

)}

{category === "Paragraph level" && ( )}

) } }; export default Dropdown;
